description.raw:
We have some GUI tests that fail on Ubuntu when there is no active screen attached. We disable these tests in jenkins, and they consistently fail in my overnight testing. The list is not completely accurate, though:

* The [ViewAngleWidget_TEST](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/%28root%29/ViewAngleWidget_TEST/EmptyWorld/history/) usually fails without a screen (not sure why it sometimes passes in jenkins since it always fails in overnight testing), so I've added it to the list. **Update** Ian fixed this test and I merged it into this branch!
* There are 6 other tests in the list that actually pass without a screen ([jenkins results](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/80/testReport/)), so I've removed them from the list.

It would be even better to figure out how to make the tests pass without a screen, but we'll save that for another day.

I also alphabetized some cmake lists.
description.html:
We have some GUI tests that fail on Ubuntu when there is no active screen attached. We disable these tests in jenkins, and they consistently fail in my overnight testing. The list is not completely accurate, though:

  • The ViewAngleWidget_TEST usually fails without a screen (not sure why it sometimes passes in jenkins since it always fails in overnight testing), so I've added it to the list. Update Ian fixed this test and I merged it into this branch!
  • There are 6 other tests in the list that actually pass without a screen (jenkins results), so I've removed them from the list.

It would be even better to figure out how to make the tests pass without a screen, but we'll save that for another day.

I also alphabetized some cmake lists.
